title: [Economics] During the COVID pandemic, US unemployment benefits were increased by $600 a week. This reduced the tightness of the labor market (less competition among job applicants), but it did not reduce employment. Thus, increased unemployment benefits during the COVID pandemic had beneficial effects.

[Psychology] The psychological toll of losing a job due to COVID-19 caused many young hotel and restaurant workers to consider changing careers. Laid-off hospitality employees—particularly women and younger workers—reported being financially strained, depressed, socially isolated and panic stricken.
